attributes.action: Tougher sentences for criminals carrying out vehicle theft
attributes.background:
I recently went through the emotional torture of having my home broken into, my personal belongings rummaged through all in order to steal my 4 week old car from my driveway.
To say I'm heartbroken would be an understatement and anyone that has been through similar would understand these feelings.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the past 3 years, vehicle theft has increased by over 30%!! 40 police forces within England and Wales reported over 85,000 cases last year alone meaning the true figure is tremendously higher.
There is a lot of money in vehicle theft and with the sentence currently standing at 12 months (if charged as High Culpability), you can understand why its on the increase as the criminals feel untouchable

We demand that Vehicle Theft Criminals MUST face far tougher sentences

attributes.action: Make it law that airlines allow special assistance car seats on planes
attributes.background: Currently cabin crew have the discretionary power to reject a car seat, and therefore a disabled child their holiday or important trip. Children over the age of 2 may still need a car seat. Intellectual or physical disability can make a standard lap belt unsafe for travel. Make travel inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
On a recent trip with my 5 year old son we were allowed to take our car seat right up to the plane steps. We were then told the seat and therefore my son were not allowed on the plane by the luggage loaders. When questioned it was explained and confirmed that it was at the discretion of the cabin crew.

Having booked time off, travelled to the airport, had special assistance how is it not law that disabled children be allowed on board with whichever equipment they need to make travel accessible

attributes.action: Allow Term Time Holiday Requests during last week of Summer Term.
attributes.background: The law currently stands that students are not to be taken out of school during term time.  Why is it allowable for schools themselves to do this during the last week of the summer term for trips to Disneyland but not for parents? This is a double-standard.
attributes.additional_details:
A trip to Roman ruins in Paphos, the soon to be lost islands of the Maldives or Red Square in Moscow would be far more educational than a trip to Disneyland. However requests by parents to take children on holiday during the last week of the summer term are routinely denied yet schools offer our children non-educational elitist "trips".

The law needs to be changed to allow essential family time for holidays outside of the defined school holiday period. An open debate for a solution is needed.

attributes.action: Treat knife crime as a health issue, to tackle the current epidemic in London.
attributes.background: Treating knife crime as a health issue is credited with prompting a dramatic drop in stabbings in Scotland, with the decline most pronounced in Glasgow, a city that once had one of the highest murder rates in western Europe.

attributes.action: Debate the Whip system in the House of Commons for a major reform of the system.
attributes.background: A major reform of the whips system is essential to bring back meaningful debate to parliament.  The power of the whips inhibits democracy and encourages a herd instinct and mindlessly partisan behaviour. The power Whips currently hold encourages a lack of integrity and independent thought.
attributes.additional_details: The roles of the whips are secretive, but they appear to influence who sits on committees to question government ministers and having some say over who becomes chairman of the committee. They have too much power and too much say over what happens to MPs. Coercing, threatening or otherwise telling elected MPs how to vote should be outlawed. The notion of "whipping" members into the voting lobbies is yet another slap in the face of democracy and only benefits the party and executive branch.

attributes.action: Revoke journalist Lauren Southern's ban from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern is a right-wing Canadian journalist who has been banned from entering the UK by the UK Home Office. 
Whilst she does hold views that are deemed controversial, the decision to ban her is unprincipled, immoral, and an anti-productive way to go about dismantling racism.
attributes.additional_details:
Lauren Southern is a Canadian born journalist who rose to fame online when she held up a sign explaining why she does not identify as a feminist. 
Since that photograph, she went on to work for the right-wing media outlet 'Rebel Media', which she has since left to pursue a career as an independent journalist/YouTube personality.

attributes.action: Make vaccinations a requirement before a child can be enrolled in a school
attributes.background: At various stages throughout childhood, vaccines are administered to prevent fatal diseases that have killed millions of children in recorded history. They're vital to our survival and to those who cannot be immunised for medical reasons. Herd immunity only works if enough people are vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier in 2017, the UK celebrated that measles had been eradicated in this country. This was hindered in the 90s by the work of (former Doctor) Andrew Wakefield. I accordance with WHO policy, 'eradicated' does not mean it was completely destroyed. It takes a 95% clearance to gain this status. There has, however, been a resurgence after the rise of the antivaxxer movement and foreign nationals entering the UK who carry such diseases. It takes one person to spread childhood disease.

attributes.action: Reinstate ICT at GCSE
attributes.background:
GCSE ICT was scrapped in favour of promoting Computer Science. According to JCQ (Joint Council for Qualifications) over 110,000 pupils studied for the qualification in 2015. Not all students want to program and many are missing out on vital skills.
We ask you to sign to have GCSE ICT reinstated
attributes.additional_details:
The main reason for scrapping ICT was to promote more academic subjects such as Computer Science however not everyone wants to program and students are missing out on key skills needed for many industry jobs such as spreadsheets, databases, word processing, photo editing and rapid web development which Computer Science does not cover.
Vocational qualifications in ICT are available but they are not nearly as rigorous as GCSE and many academic students are put off studying them.

attributes.action: Raise world wide awareness for kidney condition, Loin Pain Hematuria Syndrome.
attributes.background: Loin Pain Hematuria Syndrome is a rare kidney condition. It has only been documented by just over 1000 worldwide due to it being so rare. This condition is severely disabling, often meaning the person can not work or care for themselves. More information needs to be known and more research done.
attributes.additional_details: By helping us sign the petition, you could be helping people who are suffering in silence. If more information was provided by the medical profession then diagnosis would be easier. I would like to get a plan of action to get leaflets and adverts showing symptoms and how a patient can manage. I don’t want anyone to feel like they are alone with this condition.

attributes.action: Drivers who kill should face life sentences
attributes.background: My son was involved in a RTA and died at the scene. We think that how long the person gets for death by dangerous or careless driving under the influence of drink, drugs or mobile phones is wrong and believe this should be a life for a life sentence.

attributes.action: Raise the tax threshold of Personal Allowance reduction to above £100,000
attributes.background: Currently, an individual’s Personal Tax Allowance reduces when annual income is above £100,000, by £1 for every £2 earned above this limit. This £100,000 limit has not been increased since its introduction in 2010-11.
attributes.additional_details: Whereas Personal Allowance values have almost doubled since the 2010-11 tax year (£6475 to £11500), the £100,000 earnings limit has not increased since introduction. Therefore, whilst Personal Allowances increase in line with the cost of living, the £100,000 earnings cap does not. Consequently, families of individuals earning over £100,000 are disadvantaged, with tax/child credits already abolished for any family earning over £50,000. The income limit for this PA reduction should be increased.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to publish pro-anorexia material online
attributes.background: Anorexia as well as bulimia and other eating disorders are killers. Pro-eating-disorder websites promote bad and dangerous habits –some of which have resulted in serious hospital treatment for me. Anyone can read these websites and be influenced!
attributes.additional_details: jodie_eats_to_live is my recovery account. We need accounts that are honest, and that show recovery and allow people to witness sufferers become so happy and positive! We need positivity and encouragement!

attributes.action: The Government to pressure the Indian Government to release Jagtar Singh Johal
attributes.background: Jagtar Singh Johal from Dumbarton, West Dunbartonshire, had a sack thrown over his head and was forced into a van by plain-clothes officers on 4 November. The Police in Punjab secretly presented Jagtar Singh Johal before the duty magistrate without informing his family or legal counsel.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Johal, was in India since 2 October for his wedding. He was arrested by Punjab police on November 04 and was presented before a duty magistrate by the police on 05 November. The court had sent him on police remand until 10 November. His remand extension was secretly submitted to the magistrate court so that neither his family or legal counsel could plea against the extension before the magistrate. The lack of information being provided by the authorities is alarming. #freejagginow

attributes.action: Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK.
attributes.background:
Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK 

Prong collars / Pinch collar
Choke Collars
Shock collars / E Collars
Electric dog fence and door mats
attributes.additional_details:
In modern world science has given us the tools we need to train mans best friend without pain and fear. Using outdated training collars that causing pain and fear needs stopping.

It is now your turn to be your dogs best friend and put a stop to all aversive dog training equipment.

attributes.action: Ban use of Automatic Number Plate Recognition unless investigating crime
attributes.background: Since ANPR is by definition, a tool of mass surveillance, requiring no 'probable cause' to investigate the whereabouts of law-abiding citizens, it has no place in a free society.
attributes.additional_details: For the reasons mentioned above, I consider the use of ANPR, for anything other than the investigation of crime, to be an illegal act. It is incompatible with the principles of 'innocent until proven guilty', which has been a cornerstone of British justice for centuries. ANPR has been installed as a 'fait accompli', enabling routine and blanket mass surveillance of the British population. Simply put, unless I am a criminal suspect, it is none of the government's business where I go in my car.

attributes.action: Set a maximum premium level for car insurance.
attributes.background: Since the law requires any driver to be insured, there should be a legal maximum the insurers can charge for the annual premium with a basic cover that is acceptable by law.
attributes.additional_details: The government should ensure that a maximum charge is set giving the basic cover needed by law for full comprehensive and third party. The law requires drivers to be insured, the law should also state the maximum that can be charged for this service.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to declare allergenic ingredients in alcoholic distillates
attributes.background: By law, allergens on ingredients lists must be highlighted by means including bold type, italics, underlining - anything that emphasises the presence of 1 of the 14 allergens. Alcoholic distillates are exempt from this law and do not have to declare the allergenic ingredients - a danger to many.
attributes.additional_details: I bought my boyfriend some chocolates for Valentine's from a well-known chocolate shop. He has a severe nut allergy and has been hospitalised before. I checked the ingredients many times and asked staff to check - nuts weren't listed as an allergen. On opening the chocolates, one contained hazelnut liqueur - which by law doesn't have to be declared as an allergen. This is dangerous, and could have killed my boyfriend. Action needs to be taken so derived products also have to declare allergens.

attributes.action: Remove date of birth from the Companies House open register.
attributes.background:
Having recently been a victim of identity theft, it transpired they collected my contact details from the open Companies House register.

It appears easy to set up a credit account for online retailers using name, date of birth and address.

Leaving 3.9m company directors open to identity theft.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to petition the government to remove the date of birth field from the Companies House register in order to make it slightly harder for criminals to undertake simple identity theft such as this.

As cyber crime becomes more prevalent and larger businesses tighten their security, small and medium businesses (and their owners) will become an easier target.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate meaning and functioning of democracy in Britain
attributes.background: The government’s reply to a petition calling for a referendum on any deal with the European Union misunderstands democracy, a process whereby nothing is set it stone. We want to hear, on behalf of the British people, what parliament thinks democracy is in Britain, and how it will uphold it.
attributes.additional_details: The reply says that there can be no attempt to reverse the result of a narrowly won, advisory referendum, as it is the will of the people.Yet the will of the people last June overturned a 2015 election and did not deliver a government majority. The petition was not calling for a second referendum on leaving the EU (which would be a third after 1975 and 2016) but a first referendum on the exit deal (it seems pointless to call for a debate on the DeXEUs reading and comprehension skills).

attributes.action: Provide free sanitary products to young women receiving free school meals
attributes.background: Recent media reports have highlighted issues relating to what is being described as period poverty. 137,700 UK girls miss school each year in addition to putting their health at risk trying to manage without these essential items. Cannock Soroptimists believe funding is needed to end period poverty.
attributes.additional_details: SI Cannock have established that this is both a local and national issue. The following links provide further information:- https://www.always.co.uk/en-gb/about-us/endperiodpoverty http://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-03-15/period-poverty-the-women-forced-to-choose-between-food-and-sanitary-products/ https://inews.co.uk/inews-lifestyle/women/period-poverty-girls-toilet-roll-afford-tampons/

attributes.action: Call for the government to re-form the RNXS and recruit members
attributes.background: UK Border Force and the Home office is currently considering the potential benefits of a Border Force Special Volunteer force,
attributes.additional_details:
Perhaps they have forgotten we use to have a service that was perfectly suited to that role  

The Royal Naval Auxiliary Service (R.N.X.S) was a uniformed, unarmed, civilian volunteer service, administered and trained by the Royal Navy to operate in the ports and anchorages of the UK
It maintained training units, and vessels at most major ports in the UK. and was formed in 1963 The service was disbanded on 31 March 1994 Back when  the nuclear threat was not as serious as it has become today.

This along with the new threats ,of terrorism,illegal immigration or borders are in crises.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Naval_Auxiliary_Service 

It is time to resurrect the RNXS

attributes.action: Close the 6 US military bases in the UK.
attributes.background: Magna Carta guarantees the removal of foreign forces following the restoration of peace. In 1942, after Japan attacked Hawaii, American forces established bases in the UK to fight Nazi Germany. In 1945 Adolf Hitler killed himself. On 8 October 2017 American forces still occupied 6 bases in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Magna Carta Clause (51) As soon as peace is restored, we will remove from the kingdom all the foreign knights, bowmen, their attendants, and the mercenaries that have come to it, to its harm, with horses and arms. https://militarybases.com/united-kingdom/ https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/magna-carta-english-translation

attributes.action: Make targeted adverts in public spaces illegal.
attributes.background: The advertising billboards in Piccadilly Circus, for the first time ever, will show different adverts depending on what car you drive and how you look, by scrutinising you using cameras hidden in the screen.  This corporate assault on consensus reality has no place in our democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
References:

(1) https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23631483-400-giant-screen-in-piccadilly-circus-to-show-targeted-ads-based-on-cars/

(2)http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-4988764/New-screen-London-s-Piccadilly-Circus-track-people.html

(3)https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/personalised-ads-delivered-by-the-billboard-that-s-got-its-eye-on-you-hrxwrrb3z

(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telescreen

attributes.action: Make Animal Tested products more easily identifiable.
attributes.background:
The consumer should be able to easily identify products that are linked to animal cruelty so they do not purchase them unwittingly.
Stop Animal Cruelty Now!

attributes.action: Mandatory CCTV in schools and nurseries!
attributes.background:
We have CCTV on buses , trains , shops for our own safety but no mandatory cctv in schools and nurseries for our children's safety. 

It will help parents know their kids are safe.
It will help prevent any type of children abuse.
It will help nursery management to review any accidents if needed.

attributes.action: Add a higher tax rate to Aspartame sweetener.
attributes.background: Aspartame effects many illnesses. Not just Pku. The over use of aspartame is denying people with these illnesses freedom of choice. Perhaps a higher tax added to Aspartame to encourage the use of natural sweeteners is now appropriate so people with illnesses have freedom of choice again

attributes.action: Increase maternity pay and support for working families
attributes.background: Maternity pay for working parents is ridiculous. £140 a week or less is not enough to support a child! This amount needs to be increased to take the pressure away from working families.
attributes.additional_details: There is no support for working families like there is for unemployed/low income families (sure start maternity grant.) more support is desperately needed. Minimum maternity also needs to be increased, and £140 a week made the minimum amount. This is putting a huge amount of mental strain on new families and something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Health sec, Jeremy Hunt: waive all prescription charges for asthma medication.
attributes.background: Asthma is a manageable but incurable condition, which can last a lifetime.  Caused by inflammation of the bronchial passages, it can be continuous or spasmodic. Needless to say, both are unpleasant, and can at worst be life-threatening. Triggers include stress,animals, house dust,air quality,pollen.
attributes.additional_details: At present, many people are continually on 2 different types of medication for asthma - a reliever e.g.salbutamol, and a preventer/steroid inhaler e.g.seretide. In flare-ups, and in time of infection, anti-biotics may also be necessary. This petition is asking for inhalers, and other specific medication, to be provided (on prescription) free-of-charge to all patients needing it. It is my belief that in doing so, bed spaces in hospitals would be freed up as patients would be encouraged to manage their condition more effectively.Overall savings would be made.

attributes.action: Make Leaving A Pet Dog Unattended In a Vehicle A Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
Every day we see dog owners leaving their pet dogs unattended in motor vehicles. Dogs DIE very quickly when left in vehicles - in all seasons. 

Sadly for many dog owners it is too late – they return to their vehicle to find their beloved dog is DEAD!!!
attributes.additional_details:
For a dog to die a death from hyperthermia while locked in car is painful and very traumatic – including the agony of repeated seizures prior to death….while the owner ‘JUST’ wanted to do some shopping! 

Let’s make it law that the attending Police / Fire officers MUST break into the vehicle and release the poor dog from dying. 

The Dog’s owner must be prosecuted for criminal abuse & endangering death  by deliberate & wanton neglect.

attributes.action: Ban supermarkets from selling helium canisters.
attributes.background: On the 25th of January I lost my dad suddenly to suicide by a helium gas canister. The canister was purchased from a supermarket making it easy to obtain and go through with, without any detection of what he was about to do.
attributes.additional_details:
Helium works so quickly, it doesn’t give you time to think about what you are doing because you lose consciousness within a minute.
If you think of the restrictions they have on paracetamol, it’s crazy there aren’t more on this even more dangerous substance.

attributes.action: Urge the Saudi-led coalition to lift their blockade on Yemen
attributes.background:
Due to a blockade that is preventing humanitarian aid from reaching civilians, Yemen may  face famine of an unprecedented scale.
Our foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, should use the UK's diplomatic ties with Saudi Arabia to persuade them to lift the blockade of humanitarian aid on Yemen.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recycled (in UK) single use food containers and utensils.
attributes.background:
With current bio-technological alternatives to almost all disposable food container and utensil, it is unacceptable that current wasteful practices have not been eliminated from our society.

Until organisations can prove that all materials used in packaging is recycled, a total ban is required.
attributes.additional_details:
In early 2017 a petition 'Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK' was debated. Although this raised many valid and relevant points, it did not provide a clear strategy dealing with the problem. With the bio-plastic alternatives available, legislation is required to tackle this.

Although some big corporations have paid lip service to sustainability (E.G. In store coffee cup recycling schemes), the impact will alway be superficial.

Please read the original debate responses.

attributes.action: Campaign to shelter the homeless during any night reaching sub-zero temperatures
attributes.background:
There is currently no legal protection for the homeless during severe weather - the provision of shelter (SWEP) is not a statutory duty even when conditions are life threatening

Make it a legal obligation for local authorities to provide shelter to all rough sleepers during severe weather.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.homeless.org.uk/our-work/resources/guidance-on-severe-weather-emergency-protocol-swep-and-extended-weather-provision

attributes.action: Investigate the problems faced at the Financial Ombudsman Service
attributes.background: The Ombudsman Service was founded in order to bring fair play to the financial market and to help consumers in need. Under the current leadership the quality of work and training given to investigators is shockingly bad. A new direction needs to be taken by the service to restore faith.
attributes.additional_details: Stress and sick leave have been attributed to the amount of work load being put onto the shoulders of untrained individuals. People have lost faith in the service, both consumers and employees alike have been fobbed off for too long. Many news outlets have commented negatively on the on going changes at the FOS. The only way the general public will see a positive influence by the FOS, is if parliament investigates why the changes have affected people so negatively.

attributes.action: Deliver on the promise of parity of esteem between mental & physical health.
attributes.background:
With the creation of the Health and Social Bill in 2012, the Conservative government included a demand for parity of esteem, meaning mental and physical health services should be treated equally. 
The government has since failed to deliver on its pledge and it is time for them to take action.
attributes.additional_details:
Having suffered with mental illness myself over the years, I have seen first hand the woeful inadequacy of the current system. Access to care for mental health falls way below physical health. According to the World Health Organisation,depression is now the leading cause of ill health and disability in the world, and by 2030 it will also be the biggest killer.
The government can no longer ignore the mounting evidence about the severity of mental illness, please sign and let's make a difference.

attributes.action: Make London eligible for the Clean Air Fund, including Diesel Scrappage Scheme
attributes.background: Increased taxes on new diesel cars will result in £220 million Clean Air Fund, including potential Scrappage Scheme. However, London will be taxed but NOT eligible to bid for the fund despite extreme pollution. We must ensure the Scrappage Scheme remains and must make London eligible for funding.
attributes.additional_details: The Clean Air Fund includes potential funding for a scrappage scheme to mitigate the cost of the ULEZ and other Clean Air Zones on small businesses and low income households. Government officials confirmed London will not be eligible to bid for the new fund despite the fact that Londoners face these new taxes and approximately 40% of the UK's road km exceed legal NO2 limits in 2013 according to a national assessment. Government to announce a final list of Clean Air Fund measures in March.

attributes.action: Stop anyone paid from the public purse being paid more than the prime minister
attributes.background: We pay the prime minister around £150k to run the country so it is both illogical and unfair to pay a council CE £160k or more for running a small budget operation with zero competition. We do not need to compete in the open market for those good enough to perform in non competitive sectors
attributes.additional_details: The public sector is not in competition with anyone. Your local council will not be beaten by a competitor so why do we need to pay premium salaries for managerial staff. The BBC is funded by a tax in the form of licence fee so why do we need to at newsreaders £400k plus to read the news. They are not attracting advertising and it is perfectly possible to keep promoting younger journalists if they leave. The same is true for all publicly funded or supported jobs.

attributes.action: Return the rail franchise to South West Trains (Stagecoach)
attributes.background:
Remove the franchise from First/MTR 
and return the franchise to South West Trains (stagecoach)
attributes.additional_details:
Since this franchise has been taken over by First/MTR passengers have expected soaring delays and cancellations across the whole of South Western network. 

Passengers are now expecting strike action. Due to the First/MTR wishing to scrap the guard on the train. 

South West Trains main purpose was too always have a second member of staff on board.

So by signing this petition you can help to bring South West Trains (stagecoach)  back & keep the second member of crew on board the service.

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit so that weekly paid workers aren't unfairly disadvantaged
attributes.background: Universal Credit may be stopped for weekly paid workers in a 5 week month, and they will have to reapply. This discriminates against weekly paid workers. Those paid the same annual wage over 12 months will not have months without Universal Credit payment or the stress of reapplying 4 times a year.
attributes.additional_details: For further details of this aspect of Universal Credit see condition 8 for weekly paid workers, and condition 7 for fortnightly paid workers. https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-different-earning-patterns-and-your-payments/universal-credit-different-earning-patterns-and-your-payments-payment-cycles#if-youre-paid-weekly

attributes.action: People caught fly-tipping should have their vehicle(s) seized and crushed.
attributes.background: Fly-tipping is the illegal dumping of rubbish. It scars the landscape and costs millions to remove. I can't imagine anyone not being appalled at the level of fly-tipping in this country, apart from those who make money from the activity or those with no respect for their communities and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Expanded wording of the Petition -
In addition to fines payable for fly-tipping, those found guilty of fly-tipping should have the vehicle(s) they own or vehicle(s) knowingly provided to them for the purpose of fly-tipping, seized and crushed. Perpetrators hiring or borrowing vehicles for the purposes of fly-tipping will pay the equivalent cost of crushing and replacing the said vehicle in addition to any fines imposed for the offence.

attributes.action: Make first aid&basic life support a legal requirement for junior school children
attributes.background: A large percentage of accidents and emergencies occur in a household. The vast majority of these incidents that occur have a child present on scene. Many of these children present have no understanding and practical knowledge of basic first aid which could be pivotal in saving a life or limb.
attributes.additional_details: The aim of this scheme is to introduce and educate children in junior year groups 5 and 6 how to manage minor injuries such as burns and lacerations. Also covered within these workshops, children will learn how to recognise when someone is in cardiac arrest and how to perform BASIC life support until suitable help arrives.

attributes.action: Government to make the NHS independent legal entity free from political control
attributes.background: Over the last few years we have seen goverments of all political persuasions interfere in the work of the NHS resulting in it becoming a chaotic fire fighting organisation that does not have clear strategy to address it's future direction and challenges.

attributes.action: I would like the UK government to legally recognise polyamorous families.
attributes.background:
Polyamorous families in the UK are not given the same legal protections as monogamous couples who can marry or claim benefits as s cohabiting couple . 

Polyamorous people would like to be able to enter into legal marriage and be able to receive the same legal protections as other legal spouses.

attributes.action: Provide a FREE phone Universal Credit helpline
attributes.background: The Universal Credit Helpline for England and wales costs claimants 55p PER MINUTE to call.  This is an indefensible policy that puts much more pressure on already overstretched claimants calling the helpline to chase payments, chase delayed processing of claims and many other reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
On 11th Ocober 2017 during PMQ's Jeremy Corbyn asked the Prime Minister to provide a free phone helpline, however the PM decided NOT to respond to this particular question.
 
Universal Credit (UC) is supposed to be a benefit to help people into work and support them while they do so. Providing a helpline that is essentially a premium rate number for people that are already under financial pressure is indefensible and totally unfair and a free phone number should be provided as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Bring in a 3 day cooling off period when buying an animal from a pet shop.
attributes.background: At the moment you can walk into a pet shop and buy any pet. Some stores will offer advice for how to look after them but this does not stop impulse buying of animals. Making people wait 3 days would give them chance to think properly about whether they are making the right decision in buying a pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Quote from the RSPCA website about Rabbits, “In 2017, we investigated 2,428 complaints of neglect about rabbits and more than 2,000 bunnies were rescued by us last year.” 
If people were sent home for three days after choosing any pet, for example a rabbit, with all the relevant information on care and costs over its life time then the purchase would hopefully be better planned for. This would then hopefully lead to less animals being abandoned. Pets should not be an impulse buy.

attributes.action: UK Government to work with the international community to stop violence in Kenya
attributes.background: After the Supreme Court of Kenya annulled the shambolic elections of 8 August 2017 held in Kenya by the disgraced Electoral body, the Kenya police and allied militias continue to engage in excessive force towards NASA supporters as documented by Kenya National Human Rights Commission (KNHRC)
attributes.additional_details: The blood of the innocent victims including children cry for justice. We call on the British Government to apply pressure on the government of Uhuru Kenyatta, which is presiding over this violence, to stop. We ask the British Parliament to join international community to condemn and stop the gross and heinous violation of human rights and to do all it can to stop the violence and ensure compensation of victims.

attributes.action: Ban companies from including cheap plastic toys in children’s magazines.
attributes.background:
All children’s magazines on sale in UK shops have a packet of cheap plastic tat attached to them as a purchase incentive. 

This is catastrophic for the environment. But it also creates negative behaviour in children - they should desire magazines for reading/activities not gaining more stuff.
attributes.additional_details: Cheap, disposable tat that is given for free in magazines, has no longevity and will end up in landfill before the year is out most likely. If children’s magazines alone were not permitted to include this stuff, think of the difference this would make - not only on the environment but also kids’ attitudes to reading magazines for the love of reading, alone!

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged £140 for emergency consultation, to update the database £17 and admit the pet to hospital £200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled £702.04. A further £700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing £240. 
The total cost was £1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over £3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available for free to homeless and low-income women.
attributes.background: Giving reusable menstrual products to homeless and low-income women will allow them to focus their money on basic needs e.g food and shelter, and protect women who can't afford period products monthly from diseases related to poor menstrual hygeine.
attributes.additional_details:
Menstrual cups typically cost £7.99-£20 pounds, depending on brand, and can last up to 10 years.

In 10 years the average woman would spend £240-£960 on tampons, and those with heavier or longer periods could spend much more. 

(Given that tampons tend to cost 10p-40p each and the average woman will use around 240 per year a women with an average length/flow of period will spend between £24.00 and £96.00 per year on tampons.)
